poem:
**Choreography of War**

In pale corridors,  
diplomacy dances—  
footfalls soft but  
weapons loud.  
Shells hurl across  
unspoken lines,  
leaders with pens  
map destruction.  
The distance between  
promise and peril  
narrows, tightens—  
Ukraine,  
a stage set  
for long shadows.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Friday briefing: Why Biden and Starmer are preparing to let Ukraine use western missiles deep inside Russia Good morning. Keir Starmer’s visit with Joe Biden at the White House this afternoon is undoubtedly the most high-profile meeting with a foreign leader of his premiership so far – but for today, at least, the overwhelming focus is on one issue: the war in Ukraine. At stake, after a week of intense diplomatic choreography between the two". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
